# Iran nuclear chief claims weapons have 'no place'

## Iran’s nuclear chief says nuclear weapons have “no place" in Iran’s doctrine, rejects US pressure ahead of IAEA meeting.

[![Israel National News](https://2.a7.org/files/pictures/000/1066138.jpg)](https://www.israelnationalnews.com/author/Israel_National_News)

[Israel National News](https://www.israelnationalnews.com/author/Israel_National_News)
Feb 1, 2026, 6:13 AM (GMT+2)

* * *

[Iran](https://www.israelnationalnews.com/tags/Iran) [IAEA](https://www.israelnationalnews.com/tags/IAEA) [Iranian Nuclear Program](https://www.israelnationalnews.com/tags/Iranian_Nuclear_Program)

- 2 minutes

![Iran nuclear program](https://2.a7.org/files/pictures/781x439/1043737.jpg)Iran nuclear programiStock

Iran’s nuclear agency chief, Mohammad Eslami, said on Saturday that nuclear weapons have “no place" in Iran’s military doctrine and that the country is fully capable of defending itself without them, according to the _Anadolu_ news agency.

In an interview with a local media outlet, Eslami insisted that Iran does not need nuclear weapons and already possesses sufficient deterrence.

His comments came as US President Donald Trump has repeatedly warned Iran to abandon its nuclear ambitions to avoid military confrontation.

Iran has repeatedly accused the United Nations nuclear watchdog, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), of politicizing its nuclear program. Eslami again blamed IAEA Director General Rafael Grossi for what Tehran claims was his role in facilitating Israel’s attack on Iranian nuclear facilities in June of last year.
